## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
mean_temp <- mean(data_airquality[["Temp"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(mean_temp)
sd_temp <- sd(data_airquality[["Temp"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(sd_temp)
min_temp <- min(data_airquality[["Temp"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(min_temp)
max_temp <- max(data_airquality[["Temp"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(max_temp)

mean_ozone <- mean(data_airquality[["Ozone"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(mean_ozone)
sd_ozone <- sd(data_airquality[["Ozone"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(sd_ozone)
min_ozone <- min(data_airquality[["Ozone"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(min_ozone)
max_ozone <- max(data_airquality[["Ozone"]], na.rm = TRUE)
print(max_ozone)

```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
